title: A Racing Dataset and Baseline Model for Track Detection in Autonomous Racing
author: Shreya Ghosh (Purdue University), Yi-Huan Chen (Purdue University), Ching-Hsiang Huang (Purdue University), Abu Shafin Mohammad Mahdee Jameel (Purdue University), Chien Chou Ho (Purdue University), Aly El Gamal (Purdue University), Samuel Labi (Purdue University), Chien Chou Ho (Purdue University)
background: Detecting tracks in racing scenarios to support autonomous vehicles by recognizing track boundaries in varying visual conditions.
contribution: This paper introduces the RoRaTrack dataset and RaceGAN to solve track detection issues in racing environments, achieving superior accuracy compared to existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like WeBACNN and traditional lane detection techniques struggled with racing conditions due to lack of specific training data and varied environmental challenges.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by focusing on multi-camera data collection specifically designed for autonomous racing environments, thus providing a tailored dataset and model.

key_innovation: The integration of a GAN-based approach specifically tuned for detecting tracks under challenging conditions faced in racing, including high-speed blurriness and color imbalances.
real_world_impact: This dataset and model can significantly enhance the development of robust self-driving car systems in racing scenarios and contribute to public safety in autonomous navigation.
limitations: No limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.RoRaTrack: **RoRaTrack** is an open-source dataset specifically designed for autonomous racing, providing annotated multi-camera image data for track detection.

open_sourcing: The dataset and code for this work are available at github.com/RaceGAN.
